Escape the Field is a 2022 American thriller film directed by Emerson Moore and starring Jordan Claire Robbins, Theo Rossi, and Shane West.[1]


Plot[edit]
Six kidnapped strangers wake up in an endless cornfield. No knowing who abducted them, they must survive in a hostile environment by solving puzzles using their respective abilities and with provided objects including matches, a compass, a canteen, a single-bullet gun, a lantern, and a knife.

Cast[edit]

Jordan Claire Robbins as Sam[2]
Theo Rossi as Tyler[2]
Shane West as Ryan[2]
Elena Juatco as Denise[3]
Julian Feder as Ethan
Tahirah Sharif as Cameron[3]
Emerson Moore as Business Man
Jeff Kress as Creature
Production[edit]
Crystal Reed was initially cast in the role played by Robbins.[2][4]
Principal photography occurred in a Toronto cornfield in September 2020.[2][4][5]

Release[edit]
In February 2022, it was announced that Lionsgate acquired North American and UK distribution rights to the film, which was released in May 2022.[6][7]

Reception[edit]
The film has a 19% score on Rotten Tomatoes based on 27 reviews, with an average rating of 3.80/10.[8]  Nick Allen of RogerEbert.com awarded the film one star out of four.[9]

^ D’Alessandro, Anthony (February 9, 2022). "Lionsgate Picks Up Thriller Feature 'Escape The Field', Sets Multiplatform Release". Deadline Hollywood. Retrieved February 16, 2022.
